arm_group.description: non-heated, non-humidified conventional breathing circuit was used in group C patient
breathing tube which apply humidity and heat (Evaqua™ Breathing Circuits manufactured by Fischer & Paykel)was used in group E patient
Heated humid tube with a warming device (Mega Acer kit manufactured by Acemedical,Seoul Korea)was used in group M patient

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate differences in intraoperative body temperature between heated huimid breathing
      circuit and conventional breathing circuit

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Breathing Circuits on Intraoperative Body Temperature

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  aged 18-70 years,

          -  ASA I or II

          -  patients scheduled for craniotomy under general anesthesia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ASA III or IV

          -  Duration of anesthesia time  less than 4 hours

          -  emergency operation

intervention.description: non-heated, non-humidified conventional breathing circuit was used in group C patient
breathing tube which apply humidity and heat (Evaqua™ Breathing Circuits manufactured by Fischer & Paykel)was used in group E patient
intervention.other_name: Evaqua™ Breathing Circuits manufactured by Fischer & Paykel

intervention.description: Heated humid tube with a warming device (Mega Acer kit manufactured by Acemedical,Seoul Korea)was used in group M patient
intervention.other_name: Mega Acer kit manufactured by Acemedical,Seoul Korea

primary_outcome.description: Investigate differences on core body temperature among different kinds of circuit (heated-humid circuit, humid circuit, conventional circuit)
primary_outcome.measure: trend of changes on body temperature
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the point of postintubation up to 5 hours

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: investigate the total duration of airwarmer using time
secondary_outcome.measure: total duration of airwarmer(Bair-Hurgger warming unit) using time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the point of postintubation up to 5hours

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
